snippet: In a sweeping argument to the Supreme Court, the Obama administration said any law prohibiting same-sex marriage should be subjected to a heightened form of judicial scrutiny.
abstract: Obama administration throws its support behind broad claim for marriage equality and urges Supreme Court to rule that voters in California were not entitled to ban same-sex marriage there; administration's argument does not ask the court to declare such bans unconstitutional nationwide, and instead focuses only on California's ban.

byline.original: By JOHN SCHWARTZ and ADAM LIPTAK

lead_paragraph: In a sweeping argument to the Supreme Court, the Obama administration said any law prohibiting same-sex marriage should be subjected to a heightened form of judicial scrutiny.

headline.seo: U.S. Offers Broad Support for Gay Marriage Rights
headline.main: U.S. Asks Justices to Reject California’s Ban on Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: U.S. Asks Justices To Reject a Ban On Gay Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
